From this story there are a few lessons

We are not talking about a big startup

First once we launch we will not know

when we will be able to get contracts
with big application

global

use And of course you can deploy your
infrastructure in Singapore in Tokyo in
the US in Europe And you can use
CloudFront in 20 locations around the

out And in addition to the main benefits

also able to optimize their costs by
exploring additional options As you know
when you launch an Amazon EC2 instance
or a virtual server the default way to
do this is to pay on demand You pay a
few cents per hour and of course based
on the number of machines that you run
But there are also other ways to
provision that infrastructure One of
them is the reserved instance you pay a
small upfront fee and then it allows you
to save significant costs when you run
your machines uh for example in 12
months time and you can also save money
by bidding on capacity This is the spot
instance market So there are many ways
to optimize costs and they decided to
study to to understand uh the details of
this because they wanted to optimize

course are very careful on their costs
So the two lessons are time to market

management of patients that are on
chronic medication It happens that some

fact that it's very difficult to arrange
the logistics around it some
appointments get missed and treatments
become discontinued which brings of
course huge problems in term or in terms

and then uh managing and administering

uh data on the medical conditions of

Or maybe we provide broadband uh

SMS this is how it works let me show you
um they actually uh demoed this very

the audience how this system works The
system is called TXT
alert You as a patient subscribe to the
service You opt in then you receive a
message welcome to TXT alert And then
two weeks before the appointment you get
a reminder In two weeks you will need to
go to the appointment The day before you
get another reminder and then the p the
patient might go to the appointment but
after the appointment the day after we
ask them did you go or if they didn't

were able to reduce the missed
appointments from about 30% down to 4%
So many treatments were not discontinued
as a result of this They're also able to
